intro: Cineraria glabella, commonly known as the woolly cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its fuzzy, gray-green foliage and showy blue or violet flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Cineraria glabella is typically grown as a bedding plant or in rock gardens due to its compact growth habit.
